On the Battle field!

As Tuscon and Hydras face off, the other Predacons ar=
ound them got
antsy, each one fingering his weapon and waving it, obviously=
 wanting
to pull the trigger, but none of them daring to until they got the=

order from Hydras. The sweeps above continue to fly around, their
probing =
beams watching the Maximals and Autobots as they move around.

And then Hyd=
ras spoke on the radio . . .

> opening his comlink to all Predacons and De=
cepticons's channels
> =93EXECUTE THEM ALLL!!!!!=94

As Hydras and Tuscon o=
nce again clashed, the Predacons eagerly reopen
the violence of the battle,=
 unleashing the full force of their
firepower on the Maximals! Explosions r=
ocked the ground as sadly each
of the Maximals were out numbered, several t=
o one!

One of Kup=92s blasts clips Phobia=92s wing, =93BLAST YOU!=94 she s=
creams out
in pain as her wing tip smoked from the attack. She slowly circl=
ed in
the air, her flight not quite as graceful as it once was.

=93You=92r=
e going to pay for that!=94 The crimson queen of fear said as an
ominous cl=
ick marked the sound of her autoguns engaging. With a thrust
of force she b=
egan to open fire on Kup sending a rattling train of
bullets in his directi=
on!

At the same time Talon attempted to race towards Tuscon, however
Skysh=
adow, the leader of the Fuzors stepped in the way, his weapon
cocked and re=
ady to fire, =93Where do you think you=92re going?=94 he said
as he sneered=
 at Talon, trying to kick and send the Maximal stumbling
back!

Straight Sh=
ot and Nightshift had both shuffled their way over to
Tuscon, but now in ad=
dition to facing Hydras, they also faced those
with him: Insecticon, Brutic=
us-X, Iguanus, and also Inferno. In reply
to Hydras order to execute the Ma=
ximals, their optics had brightened
as they brought their weapons to bear a=
nd powered them up.

=93This is going to be fun!=94 Insecticon said as he c=
ackled.

=93Quit your yackin=92 till the job=92s done.=94 Iguanus said as h=
e aimed his
weapon, and like the rest opened fire!

Meanwhile at the Black =
tower!

Inside the walls the spider like Predacons continued their chase, t=
he
ominous sounds of their metal legs hitting the walls creating a rapid
fi=
re clicking sound as they pursued Rat Trap and Windlord. Four of
them came =
out of the shadows their bright multifaceted optics seemed
almost hungry as=
 they moved.

The chase took them over pipes and under a bit of duct work, =
past a
bulk head and down a long passage way deeper and farther inside the
=
wall. As they ran they could see the grillwork of small vents that
gazed ou=
t into other rooms. Interestingly, one of them, as they
approached it appea=
red to be lit!

Outside the Ark!

Rodimus nodded as they all moved out of s=
ight of the Ark and moved
over under the cover of several large rocks and t=
rees. As he walked he
got a call from Perceptor . . .

> "I have an idea to=
 let our friends escape BlackFortress area... and
> PErhaps reboot Nightlig=
ht, alltough i dont know how much of her
> former self is retained" said Pe=
rceptor to Rodimus in a heavely
> encripted message"But we have to let Tucs=
on know, what Legacy's
> sittuation really is and this has been an unfortun=
ate
> misunderstanding... He's loyal to us... so far I watched... "

Rodimu=
s nodded as he looked up at Uproar and Quickstride. =93It would
seem that P=
erceptor has vouched for Legacy. He said he has been loyal
all this time.=
=94

He took a moment to glance around, putting Percpeptor on hold for a
fe=
w moments prepared his plan.

=93This mission is going to be dangerous.=94 =
He said to Leo, Wing Caliber,
Ramulus, Uproar and Quickstride. As Rodimus s=
poke, he kept his voice
very low, almost as if even here he was not sure if=
 they could be seen
or over heard. He carefully held up a small device. =93=
But this is what
I think will get us in.=94

=93A Spark scrambler?=94 Ramul=
us said. =93Where did you get that?=94

Rodimus smiled grimly, =93This was =
the one that Perceptor had given me a
while back. I had almost forgotten th=
at I had it.=94 He glanced around
for a second, and then continued. =93I be=
lieve I can modify this thing
to allow us to get past the shield.=94

Leo I=
I just looked at Rodimus, not sure what to make of what he was
saying, but =
he was willing to listen.

=93What do you mean we can get in with that?=94 =
Wing Caliber said,
obviously mistrustful. =93It scrambles spark signatures =
not force
fields.=94

Rodimus nodded grimly, =93Yes, but I believe that the=
 shield is still
set to recognize certain spark signatures, it is just bein=
g held in
over ride mode right now.=94 Rodimus pulled out one more device, =
a small
power converter. =93I believe I can disrupt the shield in a small
l=
ocalized area, to create a doorway that would allow us to enter.=94

Leo II=
=92s optics brightened in recognition, =93I see. You can play with
the shie=
ld=92s spark recognition parameters.=94 He smiled ruefully, =93It
wouldn=92=
t bring down the whole shield, but it would allow us to run
through before =
it closed on us again.=94

Wing Caliber nodded as well, =93You do know the =
shield will adjust to it
after that.=94

Rodimus nodded, =93Yes, but if thi=
s works as I plan, it will only have
to work once.=94

Wing Caliber and Leo=
 II nodded in agreement.

Meanwhile inside the Ark itself

Perceptor spoke =
into his radio . . .

> I need confirmation for my next step, I know how to=
 create enough
> havoc to Let Tucson and to others Scape but I need your pe=
rmission."

There was a short pause, and then Rodimus' voice answered, =93O=
f course
Perceptor. What=92s your plan?=94

Meanwhile little Elita, as she =
wondered through the base picked up a
bit of noise and the sound of a voice=
 . . . a voice that was definitly
not Rodimus, or even anyone that she reco=
gnized.
